skill.name: coverage-analyzer
skill.description: Advanced coverage analysis with actionable insights. Use to identify coverage gaps, suggest specific tests, track coverage trends, and highlight critical uncovered code. Essential for reaching 80%+ coverage target.
skill.summary: Analyzes test coverage and provides actionable recommendations for improving code coverage
skill.author: Atyantik

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. It provides guidance to AI agents on analyzing test coverage reports. No network access, no code execution, no sensitive data access.

content.value_statement: Test coverage analysis helps identify untested code paths and recommends specific tests to write. This skill provides actionable insights to help developers reach the 80 percent coverage target and improve code quality.
actual_capabilities: Parses coverage reports to identify uncovered lines
Suggests specific test cases with example code
Identifies error handling and edge cases needing tests
Provides actionable recommendations for 80 percent coverage
limitations: Requires existing coverage report to analyze
Cannot run tests without user permission

use_cases.title: Identify untested code
use_cases.description: Find critical code paths lacking tests and prioritize testing efforts by severity

use_cases.title: Track coverage trends
use_cases.description: Monitor test coverage over time and detect regressions before deployment

use_cases.title: Write targeted tests
use_cases.description: Get specific test suggestions for uncovered functions with example pytest code

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current test coverage using make coverage. Show me uncovered lines by file, prioritize critical gaps, and suggest specific tests to add.

prompt_templates.title: Critical Gaps
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the critical coverage gaps. Focus on error handling, edge cases, and security-related code that needs immediate test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Specific Module
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest tests for uncovered code in [file_path]. Show me exactly which lines are not covered and provide example pytest code to cover them.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage Trends
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the coverage trend over the past weeks. Identify if coverage is improving or regressing, and recommend actions to reach 80 percent.

output: Critical Gaps Found: 3 files need immediate attention
Quick Wins: Adding 3 test functions would boost coverage by 8.2%
Validators.py: 8 uncovered lines in error handling (priority: CRITICAL)
Parser.py: 4 uncovered lines in edge cases (priority: HIGH)

best_practices: Run make coverage before using this skill to get current data
Focus on critical gaps first: error handling, security, edge cases
Use parametrized tests for multiple similar test cases
anti_patterns: Writing tests just to increase coverage numbers without meaningful assertions
Ignoring error handling paths as they often hide bugs
Mocking everything instead of testing real code behavior

faq.question: Which Python testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Works with pytest, unittest, and coverage.py. Coverage reports must be generated using make coverage.

faq.question: What coverage percentage is required?
faq.answer: The skill targets 80 percent minimum coverage. It helps identify specific gaps to reach this threshold.

faq.question: Can this skill write tests for me?
faq.answer: No, the skill provides test suggestions with example code. You write the actual tests based on recommendations.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads local coverage files and runs within your secure development environment.

faq.question: Why does coverage show 80 percent but critical code is untested?
faq.answer: Coverage percentage measures line count, not criticality. This skill identifies high-priority gaps like error handling that may be missed.

faq.question: How is this different from coverage.py HTML reports?
faq.answer: Coverage.py shows what is uncovered. This skill tells you why it matters and exactly what tests to write to fix gaps.
